intro: Acrostichum crispatulum, commonly known as the hairy fern, is a species of fern native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its distinctive, hairy fronds that are often covered in fine, soft pubescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its fronds are usually lance-shaped and can reach lengths of up to 1 meter. Acrostichum crispatulum plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various small organisms.
